quest.name: Generational Bonding
journal: An unperturbed Hildibrand seeks to resume the search for PuPu's comrade.

The irrepressible Hildibrand is eager to resume the search for PuPu's missing comrade, and your newest recruit, the clone Brandihild, proposes a brilliant strategy. Instead of pursuing the alien individual, you will investigate saucer sightings, and exclude those you can say with confidence were of PuPu himself. Delion embraces this idea, suggesting a return to his workroom in Radz–at–Han that he and PuPu might sift through old issues of The Thavnairian Truth and the many accounts they have received.

A process of elimination has determined that the only saucer sighting outside of the regions PuPu visited was reported from Garlemald. The next logical step, it seems, is to journey to Camp Broken Glass, before setting out to find the author of this eyewitness account─an imperial soldier by the name of Numerious.

Delion, arriving somewhat late to your rendezvous in Camp Broken Glass, explains that he has spoken with the contingent officers and learned that Numerious was on their duty roster. The editor in chief once again takes the lead, herding your ragtag party towards the imperial soldier's posting at Forum Patens.

Although thrilled to be meeting the Truth's editor in chief, Numerious has little to add to his prior bare-bones account. His imperial comrade, on the other hand, relates how he bore witness to the same silvery saucer─before shooting it out of the sky. Using various parameters provided by the artillerist, Brandihild swiftly calculates where the stricken starship most likely crash-landed. Flabbergasted by the clone's mathematical genius, you and your companions take this unexpected advice, and turn your attention towards a point one thousand three hundred and sixty yalms northeast of your current location.

A search for the saucer turns up a scorched exterior panel, but no trace of PuPu's friend. The ensuing discussion about the vessel's probable fate is interrupted, however, when a familiar fragrant young stalker rushes over in a panic, desperate to inform you of Nashu's kidnapping. Perpetrated by a henchman of Doctor Lugae, the crime is accompanied by a message, demanding that you─Forename─present yourself at the Tower of Babil. Or else. Hildibrand and Godbert naturally disregard these very specific instructions to speed off in the direction of the designated meeting spot, leaving you behind with Delion, PuPu, and a nonplussed Inspector Brandihild.

Somewhat late off the mark, you hurry to the specified servicing facility, only to find that the Manderville men have concluded their mortal combat with a heavily modified “Suprae-Lugae.” One can only imagine what spectacular carnage preceded your arrival...

Once more reduced to a disembodied head, Lugae nevertheless refuses to admit defeat. He unleashes a deadly nasal laser in your direction, only to have Brandihild intervene, the clone's wondrous geometrical calculations redirecting the beam back to its source. With a little extra assistance from the Mandervilles, this provides you the perfect opening to execute a powerful kick, and send the gleaming skull rocketing away into the distance. A seemingly unharmed and well-rested Nashu then chooses this moment to wander in from an adjoining chamber, and, thus reunited, your intrepid team retires to Radz–at–Han.

Scarcely have you set foot back in the city when Hildibrand throws himself wholeheartedly back into the Case of the Silent Correspondent. His exit is mirrored by the equally enthusiastic Nashu and PuPu, with Brandihild belatedly joining in the chase. Godbert, for his part, appears sufficiently inspired to resume his Manderville weaponry endeavor, and invites you to lend a hand should your schedule permit. This leaves Delion, who, despite a complete lack of supporting evidence, remains determined to expose PuPu's cleverly disguised conspiracy. With your help, of course.
objectives: Speak with Hildibrand at Camp Broken Glass.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Blocky, blocky Brandihild!

dialogue.name: KOYOKOYO
dialogue.text: I knew the duplicator had been unstable, but I pushed it to perform anyway. Now look at what I've wrought: not only is this clone a poor imitation of the inspector in form, but in force of personality as well.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Blocky though this inspector may be, that Master PuPu could so easily attempt to replicate a living, thinking being... Alien technology is so advanced, I can scarce differentiate it from magic.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ohohoho, never a dull moment around the Manderville men!

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: I am...delighted. To be of assistance.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: An unexpected but invaluable addition to our ranks! With our numbers thus bolstered, I say we are ready once more to dive into the fray!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Perhaps, but what of our strategy? We need a new approach...

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: Ahem...if I may?

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: Assuming Master PuPu's acquaintance pilots a craft of similar design, then might we not instead attempt to locate the starship? Such a striking vessel will have drawn more attention than the comparatively tiny being in question.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: He has a point. The Truth receives a large number of reports from readers claiming to have observed unidentified flying objects.

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: We could review said reports─those that meet the criteria of shiny, silver, and saucer-like, naturally─and then remove instances which we know to have been Master PuPu. That should narrow things down considerably.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Indeed! What a fantastic idea!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Ah...hah hah hah! Just the kind of brilliance one might expect of one's clone. I was about to make the very same suggestion!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Well done, Inspector!

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: Ah...hah hah. I hope I've not overstepped my bounds. I am but a shadow of the original, after all.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: I have a stack of back issues stored in the workroom I use in the city. PuPu can help me sift through them, and cross off the sightings that were definitely him. Shall we?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Inspector Hildibrand inspected Inspector Brandihild with unexpected introspection... Ouch, I think I just twisted my tongue.

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: Argh! ...I mean, don't mind me! Just keeping a watchful eye on Miss Nashu. You never know what kind of unsavory knaves are out there!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Dorian has taken Master PuPu to peruse his store of past publications. Let us enjoy a brief interlude until they return with the results of their investigation.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: We've finished going through all the back issues.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: If we discount the areas we know PuPu to have visited, it turns out that there was only one other sighting of a flying saucer. In Garlemald.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: The account itself was sent to me by an imperial soldier named Numerious, who appears to be a loyal fan of the Truth.

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: All the way from the Empire? Your publication has an impressively wide readership.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Our audience has always been universal. After all, the desire to know the unknown transcends all borders and creeds!

dialogue.name: KOYOKOYO
dialogue.text: The saucer was spotted during the imperial war of succession. Beyond that, there were no meaningful details.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Then we must visit this soldier fellow in Garlemald, and wring from him the entire tale!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: I agree. This is our only lead, and we've no choice but to follow up on it. To Camp Broken Glass!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: C-Cor, it never gets any w-warmer here, does it?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Everyone present and accounted for?

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: Ah, we appear to be missing Master Delion...

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: My apologies, but I had a hunch that I thought might save us some time.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: I spoke with some contingent officers, you see, and our Numerious is on the roster of allied imperial troops.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: That does certainly make things easier. And were they able to point you in the direction of this Numerous chap's posting?

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Yes. Numerious is currently with his unit, organizing the supply dump at Forum Patens.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: We should head over there, and hope he can spare a few moments to talk.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: ...Ugh, the chill here seeps right into your bones. How are you all not shivering in that unseasonal attire?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ohohoho, a Manderville man on a mission feels neither heat nor cold!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: I'm not sure how one's frame of mind can overcome the reality of frostbite, but then again...reality always seems relative around the Mandervilles.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Hello! Is there a Numerious here? I am Delion, the editor in chief of The Thavnairian Truth─I've come to follow up on your eyewitness account.

dialogue.name: NUMERIUS
dialogue.text: The editor in chief himself!? What an honor!

dialogue.name: NUMERIUS
dialogue.text: I wish there was more to the story, but everything I know was in my submission. I've naught left to tell...

dialogue.name: NUMERIUS
dialogue.text: ...Unless you've something else to share? Didn't you say you saw the saucer as well?

dialogue.name: FORMERSOLDIER04718
dialogue.text: Oh, I did more than just see it. This was around the time when the fighting with Nerva's faction had escalated into all-out war, you understand.

dialogue.name: FORMERSOLDIER04718
dialogue.text: I'd been assigned to an anti-aircraft cannon, and was actively surveying for enemies when this silver vessel flew into view.

dialogue.name: FORMERSOLDIER04718
dialogue.text: Some new kind of warmachina, I presumed. So I opened fire, and knocked it out of the sky.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: “Presumed”? You mean you never got a look at the wreckage?

dialogue.name: FORMERSOLDIER04718
dialogue.text: We were at war. I wasn't about to venture onto the battlefield to indulge my curiosity. It's probably still out there. Somewhere.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: We have to find that flying─or should I say, fallen─silvery saucer. Do you have an idea of where it crashed?

dialogue.name: FORMERSOLDIER04718
dialogue.text: Not an exact location, no...

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Then we'd best have the gods' own luck. Garlemald's capital region encompasses malms and malms of icy wilderness.

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: If I may. Do you happen to remember the approximate speed and bearing of the saucer? And the position and firing angle of the cannon?

dialogue.name: FORMERSOLDIER04718
dialogue.text: More or less, I think. An artillerist without a head for numbers wouldn't be long for the profession.

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: ...That should be sufficient, thank you.

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: I have it! The starship impacted the earth one thousand three hundred and sixty yalms to the northeast of our current location. Give or take a few yalms.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: How in the seven hells did you arrive at that conclusion!?

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: Elementary algebra, my dear Delion. Assuming the craft belonging to Master PuPu's comrade is of similar construction, determining its trajectory is trivial.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Ah...hah hah hah! My brilliant clone, ladies and gentlemen! I was about to offer the selfsame conclusion, but once again, he has beaten me to the punch...

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Hooray for Inspector Brandihild!

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: Ah...hah hah. I seem to have stolen my progenitor's thunder. My apologies.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: One thousand three hundred and sixty or so yalms to the northeast of here! That improves the chances of our search from near hopeless to rather hopeful. Let's go and find this fallen saucer, shall we?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Ah, tut-tut! Silence, please! I must still my mind and quest afield with my senses...

dialogue.name: KOYOKOYO
dialogue.text: Wherever could it be...?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Zzz... Hot soup... Zzz... Blazing hearth...

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Oh, to always have such precise coordinates when hunting otherworldly phenomena...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ohohoho, such an invigorating climate!

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: Had someone thought to record the wind speed and direction, I might have calculated the crash site to the nearest ilm instead...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A pot, half-buried in the snow. Nothing alien to speak of.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Although promising at first glance, a closer inspection reveals this debris to be the wreckage of some vanquished warmachina.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A scorched and twisted scrap of metal plating. A starship like PuPu's could well have been reduced to a similar state were it hit by artillery rounds...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Oho, what have you found there, Forename?

dialogue.name: KOYOKOYO
dialogue.text: An exterior panel!

dialogue.name: KOYOKOYO
dialogue.text: This is from my friend's starship, I am sure of it. Debris from the crash landing...

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: I see no other pieces in the immediate vicinity, which means the vessel may have weathered the barrage and made good its escape.

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: Another possibility is that your comrade recovered most of the wreckage...or some as-yet-unknown party did.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: You're saying someone may have made off with our cosmic visitor, saucer and all? I say, this is an altogether different kind of “alien abduction.”

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Hm? Has anyone seen Nashu...?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it, where is my loyal assistant?

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: H-Help! You have to help! My beloved Miss Nashu has been kidnapped!

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: Some cad claiming to be an agent of Doctor Lugae came and took her away!

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: He told me to tell you, and I quote: “If you want your precious companion returned alive, then Forename must present herselfhimself at the Tower of Babil. Specifically, the magitek servicing facility─don't forget that part.”

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: The gall! The temerity! The audacity! My stalwart aid, spirited away under my very nose!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: My apologies, but who are you? A close acquaintance of Nashu, I assume?

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: Me!? Oh, no. I wish. I mean, uh, I just happened to be passing through...this snowfield. I'm a...snowflake inspector, you see. No two alike and all that. Anyway, enough about me─you need to go and save Miss Nashu!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: At last, a chance to stretch my legs.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: What say you, my son? Shall we get this rescue mission underway?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Indeed, we shall!

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: They left without us. Even though this doctor fellow asked for you by name. Curious.

dialogue.name: KOYOKOYO
dialogue.text: Forget the missing starship for now! Nashu is in imminent danger!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Another abduction. And yet all I can do is wonder who that odd young man was...and why he smelled so strongly of cheese.

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: I've collected what evidence remained of the crash, but solving this mystery will have to wait. The Case of the Abducted Assistant calls!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must be a Disciple of War or Magic of level 90 or above to proceed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, at the Tower of Babil...

dialogue.name: LUGAE
dialogue.text: Wee hee hee! All shall fall before Suprae-Lugae! With this new and improved body, revenge will finally be mine...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: You will release Nashu this instant!

dialogue.name: LUGAE
dialogue.text: What are you two doing here!? I specifically asked for the adventurer! Begone, before I unleash my fury prematurely...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ohoho, this promises to be a proper battle.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: I see no reason to trouble Forename. We tackle this menace as father and son─the Manderville men─together!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Agreed!

dialogue.name: LUGAE
dialogue.text: Bah, I'll not waste my appetite for vengeance on the side dishes! Hired thugs, time to earn your pay!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Oho. A little warm-up before the main event.

dialogue.name: LUGAE
dialogue.text: Get! Them!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Now's our chance!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: WaaaAAAaaahhhHHHhhh!

dialogue.name: LUGAE
dialogue.text: GaaaAAAaaahhhHHHhhh!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: The Manderville men!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Victorious again!

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: Ah... Things seem to be well in hand.

dialogue.name: LUGAE
dialogue.text: (-???-)Wee hee hee! Don't get ahead of yourself!

dialogue.name: LUGAE
dialogue.text: (-Lugae-)There you are, my loathsome nemesis! I saved something special, just for you!

dialogue.name: LUGAE
dialogue.text: (-Lugae-)Noooooooooooooooooo!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: <yawn> That was a lovely nap.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Oh. Did someone build a magitek servicing facility while I was asleep?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Nicely done, Inspector Brandihild! Once more the clone has put the original to shame!

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: Inspector, please... I am but a pale imitation of your ideal...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Hah! I knew keeping company with the famous Forename would lead me to a worthy challenge. Worthy of breaking a sweat, at least.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You've done all the work for me!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You've done all the work for me...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Work? This? 'Twas but a playful skirmish compared to your usual do-or-die dilemmas.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ohohoho, 'twas rude of us not to share a slice of the action! Yet even vaunted champions such as yourself must rest their bodies and let others rise to the occasion from time to time.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: The villain is vanquished, and Nashu is returned to us safe and sound. I say we head back to Radz–at–Han to regroup and rethink our position.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Your comrade yet lives, Master PuPu, I am certain of it. Take heart, and let us continue the search.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: I remember standing in the snow, and dreaming of being warm...then suddenly, I wasn't cold anymore. Isn't that odd? Maybe I should fall asleep in uncomfortable places more often!

dialogue.name: OKKAKE
dialogue.text: Phew... I don't know what I would have done had Miss Nashu been harmed. Clearly I need to track her comings and goings even more closely!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: To Garlemald and back have we journeyed, yet this is just the beginning of the Case of the Silent Correspondent!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Come, my friends! The shard of saucer we secured shall lead us onwards to new discoveries!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Wait for me, Inspector! I don't know which way is “onwards”!

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: I...should follow him, shouldn't I?

dialogue.name: BRADIHILND
dialogue.text: W-Wait! Wait for me!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: That bracing melee was just what the chirurgeon ordered! A spot of exertion to stimulate the mind, and I find myself ready to grapple with the finer points of forging again.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Your assistance in this historic reproduction of Manderville weaponry would be, as always, most welcome.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: A final word from yours truly, if I may?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: The complexities of Godbrand's techniques had me flummoxed, I confess, but I do believe this recent spot of exertion has provided just the inspiration I required.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: When you are ready to proceed with our endeavor, pray drop a word in Master Gerolt's ear. I shall make myself available forthwith.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Until our next meeting!

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Thank you for assisting with my investigations, Forename.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: Once again, our travels were rife with inexplicable phenomena, and yet I am no closer to exposing PuPu's well-concealed conspiracy.

dialogue.name: DELION
dialogue.text: He will slip up one day, though, and you and I will be there to catch him!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, somewhere in Thavnair...

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSMAN
dialogue.text: (-Mystery Man-)You took my coin and you failed. What audacity that you should return, seeking my largesse once more.

dialogue.name: LUGAE
dialogue.text: (-Lugae-)I deserve your scorn. But I promise you, your plans are in danger so long as that tenacious pest yet lives.

dialogue.name: LUGAE
dialogue.text: (-Lugae-)I know of a path to victory─a forbidden path. One which demands the manifestation of the divine...

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSMAN
dialogue.text: (-Mystery Man-)...You have my attention.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alien friends with strange technology♪

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Cloning yourself can lead to tragedy♪

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
But sometimes you get♪
What you don't expect♪
A blocky man of quality─Inspector Brandihild♪

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Flat-faced for sure but still sharp as a tack♪
